title: As BOC, I can view intl signing bonus slots that are part of a trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that an intl signing bonus slot was part of a trade
custom_steps: WHEN BOC views that trade
custom_expected:
THEN display under the Org that it originally belonged to, under sub-section 'International Signing Bonus Slot'
AND

- Show the slot details in view mode with the columns shown in the wireframe
- Data in ebis 1 should match ebis 2

title: As BOC, I can view Rule 4 draft picks that are part of a trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that a rule 4 draft pick was part of a trade,
custom_steps: WHEN BOC views that trade
custom_expected:
THEN display under the Org that it originally belonged to, under sub-section 'Rule 4 Draft Pick'
AND

- Show the draft pick details in view mode with the columns shown in the wireframe
- The Player column is blank until the respective draft has passed at which point, display the player who was drafted with that Round/Pick
- Player name should link to player history
- Data in ebis 1 should match ebis 2

title: As a club, I can create and save a  preliminary trade from the roster
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user is on a screen where the "create new" button is present (either in a player's header, or on the MJ/MN rosters)
custom_expected:
THEN

- The user sees the "Outright Trade" option to the Create New menu. It should be under "Assignments" for both Major and Minor League Transactions.
- On selecting this option, create a new Preliminary trade.
- The Preliminary trade is pre-loaded with the Org that the player belongs to and the player's details in Edit mode
- Club can change the player using the dropdown to pick any other player on that Org's Major or Minor league roster. If the Trade is a Minor league trade, limit to only Minor league players
- Pos, Roster status and 'From Club' (if the player is in the minor league) columns should populate automatically 
' To org' and 'To club' columns are disabled until additional orgs are added to trade (later story)
- 'Received Ins form' is a date picker and blank by default
- Player, To Club and To Org column headers have a required field asterisk
- Transaction can be saved in preliminary
- The Preliminary transaction can be found through Advanced search (each player is listed as a separate search result)

**Global**
- Cancel button prevents changes from being saved

**Note**
- Attachments and uploads will be added in a later story
- Written consent column should be hidden and will be introduced in a later story

title: As a club, I want to add comments and attach files to the Trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- Club can attach files to the Trade using the general form Attached files section
- Available labels are 'Assignment Agreement" and "Miscellaneous"
- Global attached files features should work such as deleting, drag and drop etc
- Club can also enter comments into the comment section.

AND

- Only editable in edit mode
- User can delete attachments
- User can leave comments
- User can use drag and drop or Browse buttons to attach
- The functionality should match what has been implemented in Add Cs, MJC, Transactions etc

title: As a club, I can select the Orgs that will participate in my trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
**Wireframe:**
http://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=add_additional_orgs

THEN

- ADD ORG button appears as shown in wire
- Clicking on this button lets you select 1 or more Orgs using multi-select
- Clicking 'Add' creates a section header for each Org on the Trade screen. 
- The Section header has a delete icon that will remove the Org from the screen
- Once an Org is added to the screen, it cannot be selected from the dropdown to be added again unless it is deleted.
- A club user cannot delete thier own Org from the screen
- 'Cancel' button in the popout closes the pop out. Clicking anywhere else on the screen closes the pop out

title: As a club, I want to select an Authorized signatory for each Org
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- For each Org on the screen, add an "Authorized Signatory' field. 
- The dropdown for each Org shows that Org's Authorized signatories
- If it's a Minor league Trade, only show Signatories with 'MN Trans' in the signatory widget. 
- If it's a Major league trade, only show Signatories with 'MJ Trans' checked in the signatory widget
- This field is not required.
- The "Create New" option only appears next to the Authorized Signatory field of the logged in club. Club can use this to add a new signatory from the form.

title: As a club, I want to add a player to be named later to the trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN a club creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN club can use the  "Add Considerations" menu to add a 'Player(s) to be Named' Section to any Org. it can only be added once per Org
AND the 'To' dropdown lists Orgs participating in the trade except the Org that the section is under (Field is required)
AND On/Before is a date picker. Limit date range value from 1 month past until 2 years into the future. (Field is required)
AND 'Alternative Cash Consideration' column only accepts numbers. Auto-add commas. (Field is required)
AND Competitive Balance Amount column is locked for editing and has the same value as Alt Cash Consideration
AND 'Paid on' field is not editable to clubs.
AND Section can be removed with the delete icon
AND Additional rows can be added. Each row forms it's own separate table as shown in wire.
AND If all rows are deleted, remove the section automatically

title: As a club, I can enter an Intl signing bonus slot consideration
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
**Wire**
http://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=intl_signing_bonus_slot

**AC**
- Club can use the "Add Considerations" menu to add a 'International Signing Bonus Slot' Section to any Org. It can only be added once per Org
- The 'To' dropdown lists Orgs participating in the trade except the Org that the section is under. Field is required
- The 'Slot' dropdown lists all intl bonus Slots allocated to that club. This information has to ETL-ed from EBIS 1. This field is required
- Once a slot is selected, the amount column is autopopulated with the value of the slot
- Section can be removed with the delete icon
- Additional rows can be added. Club cannot re-enter the same slot to trade in multiple rows
- If all rows are deleted, remove the section automatically

title: As BOC, I can add a conditional cash consideration
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- Only BOC users can use the "Add Considerations" menu to add a Conditional Cash Section to any Org. This section is not visible to club users
- A maximum of one Conditional cash consideration can be added per org so this option is no longer available in the menu once added
- The 'To' dropdown lists Orgs participating in the trade except the Org that the Cond. cash section is under. Field is required
- Amount column only accepts numbers. Auto-add commas. Field is required
- Luxury Tax Amount column is automatically pre-populated with the same value as Amount but can be changed by BOC
- Payable on/Before is a date picker. Limit date range value from 1 month past until 2 years into the future. Field is required
- 'Paid on' field and 'Not met' fields are editable but not required.
- Comments can be added to each row
- Additional rows can be added.
- If conditions in #126242571 and #126242309, then show the 'BOC Approved' column which is required
- Section can be removed with the delete icon
- If all rows are deleted, remove the section automatically

title: As BOC, I can add a pay schedule for conditional cash considerations
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- A pay schedule can be added for each row in the Conditional Cash section by BOC
- All expected results in [C204999](http://10.199.1.138/testrail/index.php?/cases/view/204999&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=28563) must be met except that this is BOC only functionality and BOC can edit the "Paid on" column in the pay schedule.

title: As a club, I can enter a Rule 4 draft pick consideration
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- Club can use the "Add Considerations" menu to add a 'Rule 4 Draft Pick' Section to any Org. it can only be added once per Org
- The 'To' dropdown lists Orgs participating in the trade except the Org that the section is under. Field is required
- 'Year' is the next upcoming draft year and not editable
- Lottery column is locked to 'Competitive Balance and not editable
- Round / Pick column lists the Round Name and Pick number (eg. CBA - 2) that the club has available to it in the upcoming draft. This comes from the Pre-Draft screen where they are entered. If the club has no picks to trade, dropdown has no options. This is a required field.
- Player column is hidden until after the draft is over
- Section can be removed with the delete icon
- Additional rows can be added. Club cannot re-enter the same pick to trade in multiple rows
- If all rows are deleted, remove the section automatically

title: As BOC, I can create a trade on behalf of the club
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_expected:
THEN

- BOC can create and save a Trade using the Create New menu on any player 
- The 'Paid on' fields are editable to BOC on Cash considerations, Pay schedules and Player to be Named sections. Clubs cannot edit the Paid on field
- BOC can send MJ players to MN club and vice versa. The restrictions in #126081417 do not apply to BOC
- BOC can add new signatories for any club involved in the trade
- BOC can add additional rows for cash considerations for any Org
- BOC can see and update BOC Notes section
- BOC can upload files for all player rows for all involved Orgs in the Player section

title: As a club or BOC, I want to delete a preliminary trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN That user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- The delete button is available
- Hitting delete prompts a warning. Continuing deletes the TX and returns you to previous page. Cancelling out of warning returns you to transaction

title: As a club, I can add additional players to the Trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- An 'Add Consideration' button appears under each Org Section
- Club can add a player section to any Org using the Add Consideration button
- The player dropdown shows a list of all Major and Minor league players in the corresponding Org. If the Trade is Minor league, limit to just MN players
- Once you add a player, you cannot re-add the same player
- The 'To Org' column is enabled when at least 2 or more Orgs are part of the trade. The dropdown lists all of the Orgs in the trade except for the one the player is coming from. The dropdown should default to the first Org in the list
- The 'To Club' column is enabled when the 'To Org' column is selected. It shows a list of major and minor league affiliates of the To Org
- Club can add additional rows to an existing player section for any Org
- Club can delete any row. If all rows are deleted, the entire Player section is removed for that Org.
- The entire player sub section can also be deleted using the Delete icon in the player sub section header
- Player sub section can only be added once per Org, so once added, it does not show in the 'Add Consideration' button dropdown

title: As a club, I want to attach forms for each player
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a player to a trade
custom_expected:
**Wireframe:**
http://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=add_attachments_to_considerations

THEN 

- Show an upload button against each player when the form is in edit mode as shown in wire.
- A club can only view the upload icon for players currently in thier Org
- Clicking on upload icon, opens an attached files popout
- Available labels are 'Notice of Disposition', 'Insurance Form' and 'Miscellaneous'
- Hitting 'continue' on the pop out closes the modal. However user must save the main form to fully save the attachments
- Hitting cancel undoes any changes to attached files
- Hitting anywhere outside closes the pop out
- User can use drag and drop and delete attachments from the pop out.

title: As a club, I want to be stopped from trading an MJ player to an MN team or MN player to MJ team
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a player to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- When populating the Player section of a trade, if the club selects a Major League player, lock the "To Club" field for that row and default the field to the major league club
- If a Minor league player is picked, re-enable the "To Club" field.
- If a Minor league player is selected, remove the Major league club option from the "To Club" dropdown
- Use player's 'Pending club' if he has one before using Current club

title: As a club, I want to know if a player's MJ contract contains special covenants
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a player to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- If any of the players involved in the trade have an active Major league contract and that MJ contract has special covenants, show a flag to the left of the player name
- The flag column should appear only if at least one player in the table has a flag
- On clicking on the flag, open pop out  with text as shown in wire and list out the Special covenant names. Clicking anywhere outside the pop out closes it

title: As a club, I want a player to be flagged if his MJ contract has unearned bonuses
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a player to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- If any of the players involved in the trade have an active Major league contract and that MJ contract has unearned bonuses with a start or end year that is on or after the current year, show a flag to the left of the player name
- The flag column should appear only if at least one player in the table has a flag
- On clicking on the flag, open pop out  with text 'Unearned bonuses'. 
- Clicking anywhere outside the pop out closes it

title: As a club, I want to know if a player up for trade requires written consent for being a 10/5 man
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade,
custom_expected:
THEN display the written consent checkbox for that player
AND

- The written consent column only appears if at least one or more players in the table have the checkbox
- The checkbox is an editable field
- The field is required and has a red asterisk in the column header

title: As a club, I want to know if a player requires written consent for being a recently signed free agent
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN club creates a trade dated June 15th or earlier of the current year
AND club adds a player
AND the player being traded had a XXB FA transaction in the most recent FA filing period
custom_expected:
THEN the written consent checkbox appears
AND

- The written consent column only appears if at least one or more players in the table have the checkbox
- The checkbox is an editable field
- The field is required and has a red asterisk in the column header

title: As a club, I want to know if a player requires written consent for having a no-trade or limited trade clause in his MJ contract
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a player to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- If a player has a full No-Trade clause in his active MJC for the Org that he is being traded to, then display the written consent checkbox for that player
- If a player has a limited No-Trade clause in his active MJC for the Org that he is being traded to, and the trade date is within the clause's effective date range, then display the written consent checkbox for that player
- The written consent column only appears if at least one or more players in the table have the checkbox
- The checkbox is an editable field
- The field is required and has a red asterisk in the column header

title: As a club, I can add cash considerations to the trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user creates a trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- Club can use the "Add Considerations" menu to add a Cash Section to any Org
- A maximum of one cash consideration can be added per org so this option is no longer available in the menu once added
- The 'To' dropdown lists Orgs participating in the trade except the Org that the cash section is under. Field is required
- Amount column only accepts numbers. Auto-add commas. Field is required
- Competitive Balance Amount column is locked for editing and has the same value as Amount
- Payable on/Before is a date picker. Limit date range value from 1 month past until 2 years into the future. Field is required
- 'Paid on' field is not editable to clubs.
- Cash section can be removed with the delete icon

title: As a club, I want to indicate BOC approval if an Org received over 800,000 in last 6 months
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade
custom_expected:
THEN insert a column to the right of the amount column titled "BOC Approved'
AND

- This is a check box field and is a required field so show asterisk in header

title: As a club, I want to enter amounts higher than $2m with BOC approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a cash consideration to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- In the cash consideration section, if club enters a value that is 2 million or greater, then insert a column to the right of the amount column titled "BOC Approved'
- This is a check box field and is a required field so show asterisk in header

title: As a club, I can add a payment schedule for my cash considerations
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user adds a consideration to a trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- Club can add a Pay Schedule for each consideration.
- If a pay schedule was already entered, the button is blue, otherwise it is not colored. 
- Clicking on Pay schedule opens a light box as shown in the wire
- The 'Paid on' column in the pay schedule is not editable by the club
- Club can enter the pay schedule. On closing the pay schedule, the total value of all rows will be automatically populated on the main screen and locked for editing
- System will also update the "Payable on/Before" field on the main screen with the latest date in the pay schedule 
- Once a pay schedule is entered, the Amount value and Payable on/Before fields in the main screen are locked for editing.
- If all rows from a pay schedule are removed, the pay scheduled is removed all together

title: As BOC, I can add additional cash considerations to the same club
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
THEN 

- BOC users can add additional rows to Cash considerations sections. Any additional rows added by BOC are visible to clubs but clubs cannot themselves add rows.
- There does not have to be any other special logic here as this is just an override feature available to BOC

title: As Club, I can submit a trade for other club's review
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
**Stateflow**
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req#/items/2310702?projectId=14044

THEN 

- Club can hit the 'Submit to club' button on the Trade. This updates the transaction status to "Submitted to Club"
- The status and dates section updates the field "Submitted by [Org abbreviation]" with current date/time and username

**Global**
- Show success notification
- Submit to Club button is blue

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if I did not fill out required fields
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN club submits a trade to other clubs
custom_expected:
THEN

- If required fields with red asterisks have not been filled out, show required field hard errors. When listing the required field, also list the Org name and section name
eg. MIA Considerations - Cash - Amount is a required field
- If a file has been attached to the form, then label is a required field. Show error

**Global AC**
* Errors/warnings should trigger the global error modal
* Errors/warnings should be pinned to the browser after dismissing the error modal
* Missed required fields should be outlined in red

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if the transaction date if before the player's most recent transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN user submits a trade to other clubs
AND Transaction Date is before the player's latest Approved or Submitted transactions's Transaction Date.
custom_expected: THEN show a hard error: "A transaction cannot occur before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on {TX Date}."

title: As BOC, I can submit a Trade on behalf of the club
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a preliminary trade
custom_expected:
THEN

- BOC can update the status of the trade to "Submit to Club" on behalf of the club. 
- All rule checks are overrides for BOC except for required field rule checks and bus rule 2.00  (#126260523) - at least 2 Orgs must be selected, and 2.03 #126261273
- If BOC submits to Club, make the assumption that the initiating club is the First org on the list
- For a list on onSubmit business rules, see https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req#/items/2010367?projectId=14044

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if I have not selected at least 2 organizations to participate in the trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN User creates a new Outright(trade) Transaction
AND Fufills all required fields for current club
AND Clicks Submit
custom_expected: THEN Hard error appears that says "Please select at least two organizations to be involved in the trade."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if the transaction date is not within 10 days for an MJ trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN User goes to MJ League Roster Widget
AND Creates a new major outright(trade) transaction
AND sets transaction date 11 days prior to todays date
AND Fufills all other requirements
AND Clicks Submit Trade
custom_expected: THEN hard error will appear that "Transaction date must be within 10 days of submission"

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if if my cash payments are not paid within a year of the transaction date
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN User adds a cash consideration
AND User sets the Payable on/Before date to be before or on the transaction date 
AND fulfills all trade requirements
AND Clicks Submit

OR 

WHEN User adds a cash consideration
AND User sets Payable on/Before date to be 1 year after transaction
AND fufills all trade requirements
AND Clicks Submit
custom_expected: User receives hard error that says "Cash Considerations must be paid within 1 year of the transaction date"

title: As a club, I want to stopped if I don't commit to naming a player within six months
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade with a Player to Be Named Later consideration
AND the date of the PTBNL is before the trade date
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN user sees a hard error: "Player must be named within 6 months of the assignment agreement."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if the transaction date is not within 5 days for an MN trade
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND all players being traded are minor league players
AND the trade date is not within 5 days of the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN user sees a hard warning: "Player must be named within 6 months of the assignment agreement."

title: As a club, I want to be warned if roster limits will be exceeded
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade will affect a club's roster so that the number of active or under control players will be above the limits
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN the user sees a hard error: "The club [club name] will exceed the Active List or Under Control limit. Hint: "Active Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#] Under Control Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#]"

title: As a club, I want to be warned if a MN player is not active or on DL at time of trade
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade has one or more players that do not have a pending roster status of active or DL
AND those players do not have a current roster status of pending or DL
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] is not active or on the Disabled List ."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if player is Signed for Next year
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade has one or more players that are Signed for Next Year
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN user sees a hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] is signed for next season."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if player does not have a valid MN contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade has one or more MN players without an Approved, pre-approved or Terms Accepted Minor League contract
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show a hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] requires a Minor League Contract for the current year."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if a recently signed FA is being traded for more than 50k
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND club is viewing a preliminary trade
AND there is a player being traded had a XXB FA transaction in the most recent FA filing period (the most recent FA filing period is the 15 day period on and after system date "Free Agent Filing per Article XXB" of the previous year)
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Org] received a consideration in excess of $50,000 for a recently signed XXB free agent."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if written consent is required but not selected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade has one or more players with a written consent checkbox
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade
custom_expected:
THEN show hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] must give written consent for this assignment because [Reason]"

AND for reason, show

- If reason was #126080943 - "player is a 10/5 man"
- If reason was #126081163 - "player has a No Trade or Limited Trade clause"
- If reason was #126081031 - "player was a recently signed XXB Free Agent"

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if I don't have BOC approval for amounts higher than $2m
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND that trade has a cash consideration of more than $2 million
AND the "received BOC approval" checkbox is not checked
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN user sees a hard error: "Any cash consideration over $2m needs prior BOC approval"

title: As a club, I want to know if player has an Add C salary for the level that he is being traded to
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND it is between Mar 15 and MJ Last day of season (system date)
custom_steps:
WHEN club views the trade
AND submits
custom_expected:
THEN user sees an Add C column for that player
AND if the player has a valid Add C in Tendered or higher, show the value for the  LOP that he is going to
AND if he does not have an ADD C, then show the Create New link, and a hard error on submit: "Player is missing a salary in his Addendum C for his new level of play. Return to the transaction and click "Create New" to correct this. The new C will not be reflected on this form."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if player is on a waiver bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a trade
AND that trade has a player that is on a waiver bulletin
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] is on a non-expired or pending waiver request bulletin"

title: As a club, I want to be stopped from trading drafted players before the World Series
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a trade
AND that trade has one or more players that were drafted this year
AND it is before the system date "World Series End Date"
custom_steps: WHEN clubs submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] is a Rule 4 drafted player and may not be assigned to another club until after the World Series"

title: As a club, I want to be stopped from trading with an Org that received 800,000 or more in the last 6 months without BOC approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND the user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND one of the orgs involved in the trade is receiving a cash payment
AND that org has received a single Cash Consideration Amount greater than 800,000 within the previous six months
custom_steps: WHEN club submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Org] received consideration of more than $800,000 in last 6 months. Please contact the BOC for Approval."

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if an MJ player does not have a trade waiver after the trade deadline
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND the transaction date and submission time are after the  Trading Deadline system date/time and before the day after the Last Day of Season system date 
AND there is an MJ player involved in the trade that does not have a trade waiver
custom_steps: WHEN club submits trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "[Insert Roster Name Last Name] requires trade waivers for this assignment."

title: As a club, I want to ensure that each participating Org gives and receives something in the trade
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND user is viewing a preliminary trade
AND there is a club participating in the trade that does not have any considerations or is not listed as the "To Org" in any consideration
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the trade
custom_expected: THEN show hard error: "Each club must give and receive at least one consideration"

title: As a participating club, I can see a trade I need to approve on Action items clipboard
custom_steps:
**Reference**
Button states - https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req#/items/2310830?projectId=14044

**AC**
- Once the initiating club submits the Trade to other clubs, each of the participating clubs will simultaneously receive an action item.
- Clicking on the action item will open the Trade in view mode. Refer to button table for available buttons
- The Action item has type = Transaction and Description = "Outright Trade submitted to Club by [Org 3 letter abbreviation]. It also shows the player name and date/time. If multiple players involved, show "Multiple"

title: As BOC, I can see the trade on my clipboard when all clubs have approved the Trade
custom_steps:
**Reference**
Button states - https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req#/items/2310830?projectId=14044

**AC**
- When all participating clubs have submitted the Trade to BOC, the Trade updates to "Submitted to BOC" state. Until then, it stays as Submitted to Club.
- Once the Trade reaches Submitted to BOC, it appears on the BOC's Clipboard similar to other Transactions. 
- The From Org is the initiating club. If more than 3 clubs are involved, the "To Org" column can say "Multiple".
- BOC can click on the Trade from the clipboard to see it in view mode. Updated button set should show on the form based on the button state table
- While the trade is in Submitted to BOC state, clubs can continue to have basic edit access listed in story #129462267. Use the player's "pending org" to determine if the club can attach forms for that player

title: As a club, I can attach forms for the players in my Org after trade submission
custom_steps:
**Reference**
Button states - https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req#/items/2310830?projectId=14044

**AC**
- While the Trade is in Submitted to Club state, all participating clubs including the initiating club can use the Edit/ Save feature to update the following:
- The Club can use the edit feature to attach forms for any player who is currently in their org
- Club can change the Authorized Signatory for their Org
- Club can edit or add attachments to the general attached files section and udpated the "Received insurance form" date
- Club can edit comments section
- All other fields are not editable by clubs

title: As a club, I can approve a trade
custom_preconds: GIVEN that there is a Trade submitted to Club and user is logged in as Club
custom_steps:
WHEN Club views Trade
AND clicks Submit to BOC at the bottom of the form
custom_expected:
THEN This will update the Submitted by [Org] field in the Status and Dates section.
AND the status and dates section updates the field "Submitted by [Org abbreviation]" with current date/time and username
AND Show success notification - "The transaction has been successfully submitted"
AND Submit to BOC button is blue
